intro: Crepis vesicaria subsp. hyemalis, commonly known as the winter mouse-ear, is a herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and is native to Europe and parts of Asia. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Crepis genus.
